sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Destination buffer for MAC output may point to shared memory, causing data exposure to Normal World

sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Source message pointer is attacker-controlled; large or invalid length can cause excessive processing or out-of-bounds read if TA mismanages buffers

sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Message length is attacker-controlled; may lead to denial-of-service or misuse if not validated

sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Output length pointer controls how many bytes are written/returned; improper handling can lead to truncated/partial writes or information exposure patterns

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Destination may point to shared or incorrect memory; tainted control can cause data leakage to Normal World or memory corruption.

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Source may be out-of-bounds or attacker-controlled shared memory; tainted control can trigger OOB reads or unintended data exposure.

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Size derived from tainted input can cause buffer overflow/underflow, OOB read/write, or unintended leakage to shared memory.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Destination pointer may reference shared or invalid memory; tainted pointer can cause writes to Normal World buffers or memory corruption

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size controls write extent; tainted size can cause buffer overflow/out-of-bounds writes
